title: body copy typeface for business mag
content:
Hello all :)  
I am doing a design update for a business mag and look for a new body copy face. The one used this far is Bitstreams Aldine401 (which would be a revival of Bembo of sorts), it is too thin. I need something that would at least distantly resemble it, but read better at long texts. Elegance is important :). The tricky part is that I need an OT face, with custom characters, ligatures, cyrillics, small caps, lc numbers, and all.  
Suggestions welcomed :).

 [‹ Essential fonts for windows xp](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180806/http:/typophile.com/node/17058 "Go to previous forum topic") [My second type design workshop ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180806/http:/typophile.com/node/16912 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mncz

comments.content:
Monotype’s new [Bembo Book Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180806/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/RecentReleases/2005/04-06-2005.htm) seems the obvious thing, but I’m not sure if it has Cyrillics.

Edit: I don’t think it does.

It’s not a revolutionary choice, but Minion has all of the features you’re looking for.

[http://store.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P\_1719.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180806/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_1719.html "http://store.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P\_1719.html")

In addition to Minion, Adobe offers Warnock Pro and Garamond Premiere. (Depending on how far you want to stray from Bembo.)

[FF Maiola Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180806/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&displayfontid=FF.11515.0.0) looks nice too.

I’ve always like The Foundry’s Wilson.

hhp

I chose Adobe’s Warnock Pro, as it is a little different, yet somehow delivers the about same text “color”, without the fuss. And I am absolutely in love with the optical sizes. Thanks to all who are doing this great job :)).
